CONJUGATES: spaciously (adv) | spaciousness (n) | more spacious (comp) | most spacious (sup)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English *spacious*, from Old French *spacieus* (modern French *spacieux*), derived from Latin *spatium* ('space, room, extent').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Having a great deal of room; large in extent or capacity.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （空间）宽敞的；广阔的；容积大的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The hotel suite was surprisingly spacious, offering a panoramic view of the city.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这家酒店的套房出奇地宽敞，可以俯瞰城市全景。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Extending far and wide; broad (used metaphorically, often referring to time or concepts).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （时间或概念）广大的；包罗万象的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He wrote of the spacious, unending possibilities of human creativity.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他写下了人类创造力所拥有的广大的、无限的可能性。

REGISTER: General usage, primarily descriptive of physical spaces.
